Act2Scene4.speaker: Old Man
Act2Scene4.text: Threescore and ten I can remember well, within the volume of which time I have seen hours dreadful and things strange, but this sore night hath trifled former knowings.
Act2Scene4.translation: I can remember seventy years well. During that time, I have seen dreadful hours and strange things, but this night is more terrible than anything I have ever known.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Ha, good father, Thou seest the heavens, as troubled with man’s act, Threatens his bloody stage.
Act2Scene4.translation: Yes old man, the skies that are troubled by the acts of men, threaten the bloody earth with storms.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Old Man
Act2Scene4.text: ’Tis unnatural, Even like the deed that’s done.
Act2Scene4.translation: It is unnatural, just like the murder that has been committed.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Here comes the good Macduff.—How goes the world, sir, now?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: Why, see you not?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Is ’t known who did this more than bloody deed?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: Those that Macbeth hath slain.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Alas the day, What good could they pretend?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: They were suborned.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: Malcolm and Donalbain, the King’s two sons, Are stol’n away and fled, which puts upon them Suspicion of the deed.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: ’Gainst nature still! Thriftless ambition, that will ravin up Thine own lives’ means.
Act2Scene4.translation: Against nature still! Ambition that is wasteful and will destroy its own resources.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Then ’tis most like The sovereignty will fall upon Macbeth.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: He is already named and gone to Scone To be invested.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Where is Duncan’s body?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: Carried to Colmekill, The sacred storehouse of his predecessors.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Will you to Scone?

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: No, cousin, I’ll to Fife.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Well, I will thither.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Macduff
Act2Scene4.text: Well, may you see things well done there. Adieu.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Ross
Act2Scene4.text: Farewell, father.

Act2Scene4.speaker: Old Man
Act2Scene4.text: God’s benison go with you.
